author: {'steamid': '76561198100100174', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1588117692}
review:
It's a Very fun game with an alright story, but a LOT of bugs.
I would recommend you get it if it interests you, but be aware that this is an unfinished project of a game.

Tips for beginners:

1)Turn off the music. There's a bug in the game that makes all of the soundtracks play at once, it doesn't sound too bad some times, but it's not the most pleasant thing to listen to;

2)In the safehouse go till the farest wall to the right and change your tie to blue for SPEEED (cuz health is for casuals and stealth is non-existent);

3) NEVER get the Silenced Handgun, it does 0 Damage to dogs which can easily one-hit you.

P.S.: you can crouch to not die to dogs instantly, but when you stand up you'll die.

Oh and when you buy something, you don't get to keep it if you buy something else

And most importantly of ALL: the ending is not satisfying at All and Dogs are terrifyingly OP

author: {'steamid': '76561197985759589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1563229987}
review:
This is mediocre for several reasons
1) 4 types of enemies with indistinguishable health
2) boring repetititve gameplay
3) no rewardimg for stalth kills, rage kills and such
4) crappy sory with some parts missing at all. could be really solid if you'd your mind to it
5) no explosives
6) no actual upgrades, if you pick a pistol, you have to BUY RIFLE AGAIN. WHAT IN THE NAME OF GREAT SCOTCH

So, don't waste your time nor money, 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168968716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1628027723}
review:
プリミティヴな殺し屋体験。
見た目通りにぼんやりしたゲームで、プレイヤーはゲームの基礎メカニックを把握することなく漫然とプレイを進めることになる。弾数には厳しい制約があり、無駄弾を撃つとすぐに尽きてしまうため幾らかは接近して殴り殺す必要があるのだが、その必然性が「銃を撃つより殴り殺したほうが早くね？」というイヤな疑問を想起させる。
最初の数ステージは面白いが、雑魚敵が三発撃ち込まないと死ななくなり、銃でなければ倒せない（＆移動速度が早く、触れると即死する）犬が悉く扉の前に配置され初見殺しゲーぶりが加速するあたりでプレイに猛烈な嫌気が差してくる。
また銃器や防具を購入するカスタマイズ要素もあるが、一度購入したあとで別のアイテムを装備し直すとふたたび購入し直さなければならなくなるという、あんまりにあんまりな仕様があり、１ステージあたりに稼げる金に比べてアイテム単価が高いこともあり、なんというか泣けてくる。
倒れた敵が高速スライドして画面外に吹っ飛んで行く、死亡と同時にフリーズするなどいささかバギーな面も目立ち、頻繁にBGMが多重再生されて耳煩わしい等の欠点もある。

アートワークや基礎コンセプトは悪くないのだが…

author: {'steamid': '76561198158352259', 'num_games_owned': 1713, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1554787755}
review: I got this game forever ago and I didn't hate it I got stuck on the last level as I didn't have enough money to have an arms war with the enemies I fought so make sure you are careful with money, but the thing I love most about the game is the character perspective because not being able to see into rooms that you arent in is a really appealing thing to look at and makes a nice challenge. All in all remember that this is a cheap game with a massive diffculty spike a $3 story and pretty neat gameplay. So go watch a video on it before you buy it and have a  lovely day. ^+^

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1537384597}
review:
Tags: Sidescroll Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Twitch reaction sidescroll shooter. Poorly executed. Relies on limited field of view. Repetitive and bland.

This is a simple game in which you navigaze small mazes in the form of office buildings with elevators. You encounter hostages and hostiles, and must gun down one and avoid gunning down the other and make it to the exit. Everything is black and white, the controls are a bit iffy, there is a delay between shooting and the action that is perceptible, and the hitbox work is approximative and sort of too generous making crouching or strategizing mostly pointless.

Conclusion:  You would be better off playing Hotline Miami which at least makes good use of the twitch aim mechanic and has a more straightforward level design.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/219150/Hotline_Miami/

author: {'steamid': '76561198202684314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1502533578}
review:
通关了第一遍之后来写一点评论……

游戏流程不长，两三个小时就能通关。跟其他评论说的一样，武器装备系统有点迷。强力武器我一个都没用上= =因为没攒够顶级武器装备需要的10W块钱。10W真的挺贵的，不刷钱的话大概也就能买两三件？还有装备可以重复购买，不明白为什么，换装系统什么的，也没能摸清楚。主要是打到倒数四五关的时候就不回安全屋，没法换装备了，所以带着破烂通了关。另外，暗杀系统也没能弄清，第一遍没有一个人是暗杀掉的。即使走近背后捅刀也没算暗杀，就很迷。

不过总的来说还是值回票价啦，毕竟那么便宜，闲暇时候买来玩一玩还是不错的。

后期因为没有好枪，打机枪大块头都是靠逃跑等怪刷新没……二刷可以试着买点新武器用

author: {'steamid': '76561197994025244', 'num_games_owned': 3793, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1479058029}
review:
From the first time I saw it I thought this looked like a lot of fun, eventually picked it up, got around to playing it... Massively disappointed. I'm generally extremely forgiving with indie games, but this is just shonky as hell.

I was immediately annoyed at the lack of proper menu options, then annoyed at having to either sit through the painfully slow text or skipping through the story, then annoyed at how slow the character moved, then annoyed at how convoluted the level design is, and finally annoyed at the seemingly random music suddenly becoming unbearably, illogically frantic and aggresively grating.

All of this in less than 10 minutes played... So I'm already done with it. That would be a new record.

You really should skip this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043223596', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1633493068}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031306027', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1460991389}
review:
这游戏完全是个垃圾

当我看预告片能看到了什么？快速刺激的对枪？血腥的处决？动感的音乐？OMG这些元素看起来就像是一个横版的火线迈阿密！买！
[b]然而事实证明，这个作者制作视频的功力比制作游戏本身要厉害得多[/b]
在实际游戏里，当敌人一转身时玩家就展开一场激烈的交火？听起来很刺激是不是，但实际上这个基础是构建在“敌人是我见过的射击游戏上最低能的AI”上，当敌人转身开枪时，主角可以站在他面前不到一米的距离挂机，直到玩家不耐烦地开枪（实际上游戏可以按着左键不停地射就能通过所有的关卡，比冲钱买了火麒麟的CF还无脑）
补刀？这么一个元素居然放在视频里重复了几遍，到玩家真正玩的时候，确是如此的粗糙不堪且毫无意义。只不过是玩家对倒下的敌人手动来上一枪而已，有像火线迈阿密一样会爬起来反杀玩家，和玩家对枪吗？那我还处什么绝，完全没有任何意义

　　这就是整一个游戏的全部内容

[list]
　　 [*]游戏主菜单没有设定，对话文字的像素真是复古到没人能读懂，剧情完全对游戏本身无影响，就是有门就进，有人就射，完成目标，原路返回，然后屏幕黑底白字写着“Mission Complete”，然后下一关，然后继续（直到卸载）
　　 [*]就剩音乐还没说了，游戏目录里有单独的MP3文件，留着最后一丝希望试听时，发现全部都是节奏单一的鼓组和混乱无序的背景噪音，也许和游戏的“黑暗气氛”倒是很配吧，只不过单独听就是慢性自杀......
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030869087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1461540615}
review:
Pros:
-Art is decent, yet often somewhat bland and lacking.
-Plot is alright.
-Simplistic design.

Cons:
-Most of the music is terrible.
-No options/settings menu.
-Levels are laid out terribly, most look very bland and are confusing, if not frustrating to manuveur through.
-Animations are horrible, and look very poorly done.
-Poor transition through levels, very similar to Gunpoint, with a grading screen at the end of the levels.
-Combat is poor, you can either stand still or squat down and shoot. Your oppenent simply stands up. Most of the combat consists of this. You continusly fire your gun until you die, or the other guy does, then you move on. There is almost nothing fun about it.
-Most the audio isn't very good, most notably the gunshot sound effect.
-Upgrades are unessesary for gameplay, due to the poor combat mechanics.

If this game looks intresting to you, get Gunpoint. It is a much better game and is only slightly more expensive. Do not buy this game as an alternivitve to Gunpoint. If you have already played Gunpoint, this game will be an even worse experience for you. As a former Gunpoint player, it only took seven minutes of gameplay to establish my point of view on this game and influence me on writing this review. I do not believe playing this game any further will shift my thoughts on this game in a positive way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969081524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1461355525}
review:
Contract : 

This is a indie game with old school graphics and sounds to match.

The basis of the game is to not die and not waste your ammo - if you do rinse and repeat.

I found the game to be very basic in what you can do and what it offers mission to mission but i found it quite addictive. I am at mission 14 and the game auto saves the mission your up to.

Overall = 6.5 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000738765', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1460910066}
review:
I give this game the barest approval possible. I can't really reccomend it, but it's very middle of the road game. I would maybe give it 6/10, it's not [b]bad[/b], it's just not very good. I got this game along with 9 others by buying a set of random steam keys from some online retailer. Most of the other games were very bad and unplayable and in comparison this game isn't like that. I actively chose to finish it and it killed about an hour and a half. It sort of reminded me of a flash game you might play for free or something.

This game is like Gunpoint and Hotline Miami, but without the high octane action of Hotline Miami or the clever writing and gameplay of Gunpoint. It's also shorter and less challenging than either. I don't know how this game took two games I like a lot and managed to mash them together without including anything that made either good, but god damnit they did it. That's a talent in and of itself so good job.

Let's look at the pros and cons.

Pros
[list]
[*] Playable. I know this sounds like a given, but after eating a pack of random steam codes I've found this is surprisingly rare
[*] Art is good
[*] Music is alright
[*] Cheap, it's a decent game for the price
[*] Combat is fun. This is the central mechanic and it works well enough to sustain itself for 20 levels
[*] You can probably buy the game, beat it in under two hours and return it if you want
[/list]
Cons
[list]
[*] Writing, It's just not good and I honestly just skipped past the dialogue most of the time.
[*] Length, The game is short and doesn't end satisfyingly.
[*] Difficulty. This game is really easy. The hardest part is if you get killed really late in a big level you have to start from the beginning, but you can basically play this whole game without leaving cruise control
[*] Variety. There's very little done to mix things up. A few enemy types are added later in the levels, bringing the grand total to 4. A few switches are also in later levels, but there's almost nothing to make one level feel different than the rest.
[*] In the last 5 levels you can't upgrade your stuff, which was a bit irritating to me since I was saving up money for the more expensive upgrades, but it wasn't a big deal since you don't really need any upgrades to win.
[/list]

The game doesn't really feel finished basically.  There's still a few bigs floating around too, particularly regarding the dogs and the fat guys, which can result in your dying. Really though, this game has it's core mechanics and what it wants to be down, but then it just doesn't do enough with it. It feels like there could have been more in just about every category. More levels, more enemies, more difficulty, etc. The game just sort of ends as well. The plot is that you're out to rescue your brother and then at the end, there he is and there's the game over screen. The writing could have used work as well. A lot of games are able to get past lacklustre elements by putting some heart into the story or the line by line writing, but I don't think the developers really cared about the writing at all. It all seemed pretty generic.

To be honest, I feel like the people who made this game can probably make a pretty good game, which is sort of the frustration here. They covered the basics and proved they could put out a concept and this game ultimately works. My biggest problems are just that there wasn't enough of everything and it felt like they could have worked on it for longer. That's an easy problem to fix, and I'm hopeful about future titles from these guys.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197979277273', 'num_games_owned': 2595, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1452225148}
review:
I guess I'm in the minority here, but I thought this was a poorly developed game. The gun combat is made completely useless because, for the majority of the game, you can just walk up to someone and punch them. There's no flow to the combat or any challenge. 

The upgrade system is pointless. I'm on the last level and I didn't need to buy anything to reach it. I just punched my way through it. Also, if you care about time, I'm on the last level of the game and it took me less than an hour to get there. Maybe 40 minutes? I don't think that that should always factor into the buying of a game, but for those who care, there's that.

Here's a video of me playing and basically saying the same thing, if that's your thing:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xmXOWcw77dM

author: {'steamid': '76561198003675242', 'num_games_owned': 1543, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1452303166}
review:
[h1]Interessant, aber doch nicht das wahre...[/h1]

[u]tl;dr unten[/u]

Ich empfehle das Spiel "noch" nicht, in der Hoffnung dass sich was ändert.
Doch erst einmal zu den guten Aspekten:
Ich finde die Idee von dem Spiel gut und die Pixelgrafik versprüht einen gewissen Charme.
Man hat auch die Möglichkeit die Ausrüstung wie auch das Äussere des Charakters zu verbessern welche man sich von den in Missionen verdiente Geld kaufen kann.
 
Leider endet das Gute jetzt schon und ich hätte gern mehr dazu geschrieben...
... nun gut.
 
Wie steht es mit dem Negativen?:
[list]
[*]Das Spiel ist schnell durchgespielt. Mit 83 Minuten hab ich das Spiel jedenfalls durchgespielt. Man hätte ein paar Minuten länger spielen können oder sogar weniger. Aber ich denke meine  Spielzeit liegt in etwa im Durchschnitt. An sich für ein günstiges Spiel vielleicht nicht schlimm mit Wiederspielwert, doch dies hat es bei mir jedenfalls nicht. Das Spiel sollte also für 5 Euro wenigstens eine Stunde mehr Spiel bringen.
[*]Was mich auch sehr gestört hat, war, dass das Spiel auf Dauer eintönig wurde. Die Level unterscheiden sich nicht groß von einander (damit meine ich nicht den Schwarzweiß-Stil) und man verläuft sich ab und zu bei den immer größer werdenden Maps, da wie schon geschrieben man keine Optischen Punkte finden kann an dem der "AHA" Effekt auftritt und man weiß wo man sich gerade befindet.
[*]Mit [spoiler]4[/spoiler] Gegnerklassen die sich einem in den Weg stellen ist es dann auch schnell Suppe. Das typische System funktioniert wie immer: Drauf bis es umfällt. Mir etwas ZU stumpf.
[*]Was mich Total stört sind die nicht vorhandenen Hitpoints/Hitboxen. Egal auf welches Gliedmaß geschossen wird, der schaden ist immer gleich... teils kommt es mir sogar so vor, dass die Gegner nicht einmal einen Kopf besitzen da bei Kopfschüssen meist auch gar keine Treffer registriert werden.
[*]Und das Schlimmste ist, dass das Spiel noch recht verbuggt ist. Von Gegnern, die beim hinfallen durch den Boden fallen und verschwinden, zu Gegnern die beim hinfallen durch den gesammten Gang rutschen und dabei alle Türen öffnen die auf ihrem Weg zur nächsten Wand liegen durch die die Leiche dann natürlich auch einfach verschwindet bis zu Gegner die sich nachdem sie sich „leergeschossen“ haben auf einen zu bewegen um einen im Nahkampf zu erledigen und in dem Zustand des „auf einen zu bewegen“ entweder Unsterblich sind oder einfach nicht zu treffen sind (da man keine Anzeichen hat ob man getroffen hat oder nicht ist es schwer dies zu beurteilen). Doch dies ist nicht Selten passiert... bei ca. jedem 4. Gegner ist mindestens eine der oben genannten Sachen passiert... und letztere macht es nicht gerade einfach das Spiel erfolgreich zu beenden.
[/list]

Wäre das Spiel im Early-Access würde ich oben genanntes verkraften können und hätte ich größere Hoffnung auf Veränderungen. Da dies aber nicht der Fall ist, hoffe ich zwar dass sich doch was ändert, aber ich erwarte es nicht.

Ich hoffe ich konnte ein Gefühl für das Spiel (aus meiner Sicht) ermitteln.

MfG

[u]tl;dr[/u]
Spiel ist noch unausgereift, und sein aktuellen Preis nicht wert. Man hofft auf Besserung.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981837152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1452174564}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142402047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1452041846}
review:
This game is great! It's very fun!

It's a pixel art, side-scrolling shooter in which you play an assassin.

I love the artwork in this game. I like how everything is black and white except for the blood.

It really reminds me of Hotline Miami.
Between missions you have a chance to buy weapons and clothes/armor.

At release I noticed a couple minor bugs but the developer has already acknowledged them and says they will be fixed soon.

The price seems a tiny bit high at 5 euros, but not by much. The game feels polished.

It comes with 15 levels. I hope that more will be added later because the gameplay is quite fun. Please?

Alright if you want to see my first look go here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nsP_NP5F3Kk

author: {'steamid': '76561198087803831', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1510769320}
review:
I like it. Its the first indie game by S Houben and honestly I think its quite great. It has a nice soundtrack , quite cool looking art style with some customization. It also has a bunch of different enemies which just makes it even more fun.

When I first played it I had a Hitman vibe and then found out that I could have a red tie and it just made it more awesome. I even restared the game and decided to play it from the start again but with a tie. I have yet to complete the game but there is at least 2 hours worth of gameplay. Can be less can be more depending how good you are and how fast you play.

There were some minor buggs when I played it but since then they have been fixed and it seems like the dev wants to make this the best game possible so who knows what the future holds for this game.

If you want a fun indie game to play to kill some time I would recommend this 100% Worth a buy in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011914050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1455228809}
review:
This is another reason why Gaben needs to grant us the gift of a 'meh' button. tl;dr at bottom.

Pro's:
[list]
    [*]Runs well (I can hear /g/ saying 'no sh*t, it's pixel) but the amount of indie games that have their way with my beautiful resolution and rip 144fps down to 30 is slightly worrying.
    [*]Look's good, although the environments aren't much in terms of setting (offices mostly) detail in them is nice, only gripe here is character design is a bit meh, it could be more detailed, I think it'd look a lot better. Same with blood, there's a nice contrast a bit like Sin City but sprays are too similar. 
    [*]Gameplay is fun, you have limited ammo so need to stab people when possible. But that's it, it's fun but nothing special, people have compared it to hotline miami but I don't really see the correlation apart from the phone calls. Gameplay isn't similar apart from one hit kill on some enemies. 
[/list]

I'll add more when future updates come, now for cons, and why you should wait a bit........

[list]
    [*]Bugs, I know I said at ran well but there's a few glitches, I've seen a few enemies carry on with their movement patterns despite having two bullets in their posterior lobe. That and the upgrade system is just straight up f*cked, you buy stuff and maybe it'll get added or maybe it'll just eat your hard earned cash. I've also found one where dogs don't die or slide away after killing you but for some reason you stay alive for a few seconds.
    [*]It's pretty short so far, I've only played a bit and I'm half way through the 16 contracts, I don't know if there's more to come but I hope so, I know it was only made by three people but if workshop was integrated and levels could be created it'd be a lot more fun. 
This also makes me think about whether this game is relevant or not when you compare it to Gunpoint, that game's got a tonne of content now and more mechanics than this. I generally had a better time with gunpoint in terms of, well everything; gameplay, graphics, story. 
    [*]It gets a bit repetitive, it's quite easy if you take the reckless approach (I guess this is how people are comparing to Hotline), and just run in, duck a couple times then stab the guy. Also levels don't really increase in difficulty consistently, I guess it makes a change but some of the earlier ones I player were harder than the later ones (not because of upgrades)
[/list]

I'd hold off a bit until devs add more stuff/fix sh*t, but give it a chance it did only come out today.

tl;dr: wait

author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1451946644}
review:
[h1]Introduction [/h1]

Contract is a newly released side-scrolling shooter, think Gunpoint meets Hotline Miami. Your brother has been taken and the only way you can get him back is by completing a number of assassination contracts for the only person who knows where he is. As an ex-cop you know your way around a gun but you’re out of your depth as a new assassin, do you have what it takes to get your brother back?

Full Disclosure: A review copy provided by the developer.

[h1]Presentation [/h1]

Contract has a nice pixel art type appearance going on and it looks great. Its appearance is clearly inspired by the likes of Gunpoint but the dull colours throughout and the contrasting blood red make the visuals stand out. Contract’s crosshair makes up one of only two UI elements in the game and it’s done very well. The crosshair’s size increases the further you move your mouse away, giving you a rough idea of where your bullet will hit and making it obvious that your gun has better accuracy at close range, it sounds simple but without it, aiming in Contract would probably be a lot harder. The other UI element is a simple counter in the top right of the screen telling you how much ammo you’ve got, not much to say about this one.

[h1]Gameplay [/h1]

At the beginning of each mission you’re given a short briefing on what you need to do, often including some information on the building you’re going into or the business that operates there. Once you’ve been briefed you just have to make it to your target, kill him and then find an exit. Some missions have an alternate route to your target and you can pick between the two, deciding which one you want to take. It’s also worth mentioning that your target is the only person who has to be killed for you to complete the mission, killing other enemies will award you with a small cash bonus but there is, of course, a risk that you could get killed.

The game has five different kinds of enemies:
[list]
[*]Regular guards: One shot to kill, they carry a pistol with a medium fire rate.
[*]Armoured guards: Three shots to kill, they carry a pistol with a medium fire rate.
[*]Heavily armoured guards: Five shots to kill, they carry a light machine gun with a slow fire rate.
[*]Dogs: One shot to kill, they’ll kill you instantly if they get close enough to bite you.
[*]Targets: One shot to kill, they surrender as soon as you enter a room and will never attack you.
[/list]

So on to the character you’re actually playing as. With the default gear you can take a couple of shots before you’re down for good but if you manage to survive after taking a bullet or two you’ll gradually return to full health, I have no way of knowing how fast that occurs though as there’s no health indicator. You’re given a bog standard pistol to begin with but you can purchase a silenced pistol, assault rifle and submachine gun once you have enough cash and you’re at the safe house. As well as guns you also have a melee attack which can be used to kill all of the enemies apart from the dog, unless you somehow manage to punch it before it kills you. When you’re at the safe house you can also buy new clothes, most of which have an effect on your stats. For example, you can buy medium armour which increases your health, meaning you can take more shots without dying.

Some of the missions also contain things for you to interact with, such as computers to unlock security doors or switches to turn off the lights. These don’t play a huge role in the missions like they do in games like Gunpoint but since the switches and computers are often in isolated rooms with only one way in, trying to find them adds a nice challenge sometimes.

The game’s combat is pretty simple, it’s just shooting back and forth, yet it’s a lot of fun. However, the game does have a cover system, crouching by an object will give you cover and make you harder to hit as well as increase your accuracy. Crouching away from cover also makes you slightly harder to hit and, as with cover, increases your accuracy slightly.

[h1]Audio [/h1]

What Contract lacks in soundtrack variety (there are only two or three tracks) it makes up for in how good said tracks are. They fit nicely with the game’s style and while they do of course get repeated a lot I didn’t find myself growing tired of hearing them. The sound effects for the guns are also very good, they make the guns seem like they have a real punch to them, something you would of course expect from guns.

[h1]Miscellaneous [/h1]
[list]
[*]Contract doesn’t have much replay value since the twenty missions are always the same. There’s enough content to warrant the price tag, just don’t expect much once you’ve beaten the game.
[*]Most of the bugs and issues with the game have been fixed at this point but there may be one or two left in there, nothing game-breaking though.
[*]You can’t pause the game but that’s not a huge issue since as long as you’re not in a room with enemies, chances are you won’t be attacked.
[*]Enemies do react to gunshots on the same floor as them, they won’t come running into the room and attack you but the will be facing the direction that the shots came from when you enter a room so you need to be prepared.
[*]While the three hours is how long it took me to beat the game I’d say an actual run of all twenty missions takes around two and a half hours, I had to restart a couple of times due to my save being broken by updates.
[*]The story isn’t going to win any awards but it does a good job at tying the missions together and it is pretty intriguing, even if it does have a rather abrupt ending.
[/list]

[h1]Verdict [/h1]

[b]Worth Purchasing. [/b]

Contract is a great side-scrolling shooter that’s easy on the eye, has simple yet satisfying combat and a good amount of content for the price. If there’s one thing I’d like to see it’s a mission generator but if you’re a fan of the genre or just fancy taking a side-scroller for a spin then I’d suggest you give this one a go.

[i]No drama, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/justreviews]Just Reviews.[/url][/i]

El K.
